title: How do I go about having a written response in proper legal form for a law suit made against me?
question: I was served papers that I am being sued by Hunt & Henriques for a credit card I was not able to pay any more, the papers say I have 30days to send a written response to the court I now only have 7 days left and it must be in proper legal form. I have no idea how to do this? Do I need a lawyer to write something out for me or can I feel a paper out myself? I have no money to pay for legal advice at this hard time, please any advice would help me. Thank You.
answers: Ms. Rode is correct. Make sure the debt is not more than 4 years old. Note you have to pay a fee to file this. May be better to call and negotiate the debt instead of wasting the filing fee only to get a judgment against you.

You can file a general denial which general denies the complaint: https://www.courts.ca.gov/documents/pld050.pdf

Unless you have specific defenses, then you will want to file an answer articulating the specific defenses. There are some self-tutorials online and you may want to visit your local courthouse and see if they have a help desk or volunteers that can help you out.

When you file your answer make sure you attach a proof of service that states that you mailed the answer to Hunt & Henriques.

Hope this helps.
